intro: Cryptantha cycloptera f. truncata, commonly known as the narrowleaf cryptantha, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often with a slight bluish-gray hue. The species is part of the Boraginaceae family, known for its medicinal and ornamental uses.
